name: The Frisky Foursome Part 2
mes:
Level 0 - Outside The Tower

*You woke up in the middle of the night to hear some stuff banging around. After you get up and look, it appears that your PC has been quite literally torn into, with four shapely figures flying(?) off into the distance carrying your hard drive.*

*Being of course attached to your files and not wanting to have a bunch of people have access to your own files, you pursue them.*

*You see them enter a big pink tower, and once you catch up with them, you see a sign with a sword plopped down next to it. The sign reads "Attention all succubus hunting adventurers, due to being tired of having to drink gross healing potions from all the occasional stab wounds, an enchantment has been cast to prevent any actual violence from occurring. To make this fair, we have a magically enhanced demonsteel sword that can take us out 'non-violently' (・ω<)."*.

*Grabbing the sword, you now stand at the entrance to the tower.*

name: The Frisky Foursome Part 2
mes:
Level 1 - The Kunocubus

*As you step into the darkly lit level, the ambiance is almost intoxicating. Mood lighting casts long shadows across the room, accentuating the mysterious atmosphere. Thin rice paper walls separate various smaller chambers, each one offering an opportunity for an ambush.*

*All of a sudden, a soft poof fills the air as the Kunocubus makes her appearance directly in front of you, striking a classic ninjutsu pose. She wears a tight-fitting kunoichi bodysuit that generously displays her deep cleavage, and a mysterious smile is barely visible under her black ninja mask. Her eyes glint with mischievous intent.*

*"Welcome to my level, human,"* Kunocubus purrs softly, her voice barely above a whisper yet charged with electric allure. *"Think you can conquer me and take back what you lost?"*

*In an instant, she vanishes into the shadows again, her soft curvy feet sliding away silently as she melds into the darkness surrounding you. The room feels like it’s closing in as you sense her presence moving unseen, waiting for the perfect moment to strike.*
